clinical_study.brief_title: Prognosis in the Elderly Chinese: the Northern Shanghai Study
clinical_study.official_title: Prognosis Factors of Mortality and Cardiovascular Diseases in the Elderly Chinese: the Northern Shanghai Study

brief_summary.textblock: The Northern Shanghai Study is a prospective community-based study, which is aimed to investigate the prognostic factors, including conventional cardiovascular risk factors and asymptomatic target organ damage, for mortality and cardiovascular diseases, in 5,000 elderly Chinese.

primary_outcome.measure: all-cause and cardiovascular mortality, cardiovascular events

arm_group.arm_group_label: Several communities in the north of Shanghai

biospec_descr.textblock: Pasting venous blood sample and urine sample were collected for each participant.

study_pop.textblock: 5000 subjects aged over 65 years old, living in communities located in the northern Shanghai, will be invited to participate in the present study, if they are willing to give their written informed consents.
